data.title: Monday Tuesday Happy Days
data.solution:
dayOfWeek = [ 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday', 'Sunday' ]
months = [ 'Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun', 'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec' ]
daysInMonth = [ 31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31 ]

# read input
leap = input()
startString = raw_input()
endString = raw_input()

# add one day in February for leap year if necessary
daysInMonth[ 1 ] += leap

# extract start date values
startDate = startString.split()
startDay = dayOfWeek.index( startDate[ 0 ] )
startMonth = months.index( startDate[ 1 ] )
startDayInMonth = int( startDate[ 2 ] )

# extract end date values
endDate = endString.split()
endMonth = months.index( endDate[ 0 ] )
endDayInMonth = int( endDate[ 1 ] )

deltaDays = 0
monthDirection = 1 if endMonth > startMonth else -1 if endMonth < startMonth else 0

# count delta days in start month if end month is different
if monthDirection > 0:
    # date is in a month after current
    deltaDays += daysInMonth[ startMonth ] - startDayInMonth
    startDayInMonth = 0
    startMonth += 1
elif monthDirection < 0:
    # date is in a month before current
    deltaDays -= startDayInMonth
    startMonth -= 1
    startDayInMonth = daysInMonth[ startMonth ]

# add delta for full months
while startMonth != endMonth:
    deltaDays += monthDirection * daysInMonth[ startMonth ]
    startMonth += monthDirection
    startDayInMonth = 0 if monthDirection > 0 else daysInMonth[ startMonth ]

# add delta for final month
deltaDays += endDayInMonth - startDayInMonth

# end result
print dayOfWeek[ ( startDay + deltaDays ) % 7 ]
data.statement: Given a start date with a known week day, your program must compute the day of the week at another date anytime in the same year.

testCases.title: When was that again? - Leap year version

data.constraints:

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: whether or not the year is a [[leap year]]: {{1}} if it is, {{0}} otherwise. A leap year is a year when February has 29 days instead of 28. The actual year itself is not given.
<<Line 2>>: the initial date formatted as [[day of the week]] [[abbreviated month]] [[day in month]], e.g. Monday Apr 23 for April 23rd.
<<Line 3>>: the date you must give the day of the week for, formatted as [[abbreviated month]] [[day in month]], e.g. Apr 24 for April 24th.

The abbreviated month names are {{Jan}}, {{Feb}}, {{Mar}}, {{Apr}}, {{May}}, {{Jun}}, {{Jul}}, {{Aug}}, {{Sep}}, {{Oct}}, {{Nov}} and {{Dec}}.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: The day of the week for the second date: {{Monday}}, {{Tuesday}}, {{Wednesday}}, {{Thursday}}, {{Friday}}, {{Saturday}} or {{Sunday}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a start date with a known week day, your program must compute the day of the week at another date anytime in the same year.
Input
Line 1: whether or not the year is a leap year: 1 if it is, 0 otherwise. A leap year is a year when February has 29 days instead of 28. The actual year itself is not given.
Line 2: the initial date formatted as day of the week abbreviated month day in month, e.g. Monday Apr 23 for April 23rd.
Line 3: the date you must give the day of the week for, formatted as abbreviated month day in month, e.g. Apr 24 for April 24th.

The abbreviated month names are Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov and Dec.
Output
Line 1: The day of the week for the second date: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday or Sunday.
Constraints
Both dates are always within the same year.
Both dates are valid—there is no Jan 45, Feb 29 on non-leap years, etc.
The second date may be before the first one.
Example
Input
0
Monday Jan 1
Jan 2
Output
Tuesday
